name: Social Dominance Orientation Scale (Short Form)
description: An 8-item short form of the SDO-7 scale measuring preference for group-based hierarchy and inequality. Includes 4 items each for Dominance and Anti-Egalitarianism subdimensions.
reference: Ho, A. K., Sidanius, J., Kteily, N., Sheehy-Skeffington, J., Pratto, F., Henkel, K. E., Foels, R., & Stewart, A. L. (2015). The nature of social dominance orientation: Theorizing and measuring preferences for intergroup inequality using the new SDO7 scale. Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, 109(6), 1003-1028.
instructions: Show how much you favor or oppose each idea below.

questions.name: sdo7s_1
questions.description: An ideal society requires some groups to be on top and others to be on the bottom.

questions.name: sdo7s_2
questions.description: No one group should dominate in society.

questions.name: sdo7s_3
questions.description: Some groups of people are simply inferior to other groups.

questions.name: sdo7s_4
questions.description: Groups at the bottom are just as deserving as groups at the top.

questions.name: sdo7s_5
questions.description: We should not push for group equality.

questions.name: sdo7s_6
questions.description: We should work to give all groups an equal chance to succeed.

questions.name: sdo7s_7
questions.description: It is unjust to try to make groups equal.

questions.name: sdo7s_8
questions.description: Group equality should be our ideal.
